opcodes.name: BRK
opcodes.implementation_notes:
BRK initiates a software interrupt similar to a hardware
interrupt (IRQ). The return address pushed to the stack is
PC+2, providing an extra byte of spacing for a break mark
(identifying a reason for the break.)
The status register will be pushed to the stack with the break
flag set to 1. However, when retrieved during RTI or by a PLP
instruction, the break flag will be ignored.
The interrupt disable flag is not set automatically.

opcodes.name: ASL
opcodes.summary: Shift Left One Bit (Memory or Accumulator)

opcodes.name: PHP
opcodes.implementation_notes:
The status register will be pushed with the break
flag and bit 5 set to 1.

opcodes.name: ASL
opcodes.summary: Shift Left One Bit (Memory or Accumulator)

opcodes.summary: AND oper + set C as ASL

opcodes.name: JSR
opcodes.synopsis:
push (PC+2),
operand 1st byte -> PCL
operand 2nd byte -> PCH
opcodes.summary: Jump to New Location Saving Return Address

opcodes.name: BIT
opcodes.synopsis: A AND M -> Z, M7 -> N, M6 -> V
opcodes.summary: Test Bits in Memory with Accumulator
opcodes.implementation_notes:
bits 7 and 6 of operand are transfered to bit 7 and 6 of SR (N,V);
the zero-flag is set according to the result of the operand AND
the accumulator (set, if the result is zero, unset otherwise).
This allows a quick check of a few bits at once without affecting
any of the registers, other than the status register (SR).

opcodes.name: ROL
opcodes.summary: Rotate One Bit Left (Memory or Accumulator)

opcodes.name: PLP
opcodes.implementation_notes:
The status register will be pulled with the break
flag and bit 5 ignored.

opcodes.summary: Rotate One Bit Left (Memory or Accumulator)

opcodes.name: RTI
opcodes.implementation_notes:
The status register is pulled with the break flag
and bit 5 ignored. Then PC is pulled from the stack.

opcodes.name: SAX
opcodes.summary: A and X are put on the bus at the same time (resulting effectively in an AND operation) and stored in M

opcodes.name: SAX
opcodes.summary: A and X are put on the bus at the same time (resulting effectively in an AND operation) and stored in M

opcodes.name: ANE
opcodes.name_long: Undocumented: AND with X then AND operand
opcodes.synopsis: (A OR CONST) AND X AND oper ->  A

opcodes.name: SAX
opcodes.summary: A and X are put on the bus at the same time (resulting effectively in an AND operation) and stored in M

opcodes.name: SHA
opcodes.name_long: Store A AND X AND (high address + 1)
opcodes.summary: Stores A AND X AND (high-byte of addr. + 1) at addr.

opcodes.name: SAX
opcodes.summary: A and X are put on the bus at the same time (resulting effectively in an AND operation) and stored in M

opcodes.name: TXS
opcodes.summary: Transfer Index X to Stack Register

opcodes.name: TAS
opcodes.name_long: Transfer A AND X to SP, store A AND X AND (high address + 1)
opcodes.summary: As ASL, but does not update the carry.

opcodes.name: SHY
opcodes.summary: Stores Y AND (high-byte of addr. + 1) at addr.

opcodes.name: SHX
opcodes.name_long: Store A AND X AND (high address + 1)
opcodes.summary: Stores X AND (high-byte of addr. + 1) at addr.

opcodes.name: SHA
opcodes.name_long: Store A AND X AND (high address + 1)
opcodes.summary: Stores A AND X AND (high-byte of addr. + 1) at addr.

opcodes.name: LXA
opcodes.synopsis: (A OR CONST) AND oper ->  A ->  X
opcodes.summary: Store * AND oper in A and X

opcodes.name: TSX
opcodes.summary: Transfer Stack Pointer to Index X

opcodes.name: LAS
opcodes.name_long: Load accumulator and transfer SP to X
opcodes.synopsis: M AND SP ->  A, X, SP

opcodes.name: SBX
opcodes.name_long: Compute (A AND X) then subtract with carry
opcodes.summary: CMP and DEX at once, sets flags like CMP

opcodes.name: BIT
opcodes.name_long: Test Bits in Memory with Accumulator
opcodes.synopsis: A AND M -> Z, M7 -> N, M6 -> V
opcodes.summary: Test Bits in Memory with Accumulator
opcodes.implementation_notes:
bits 7 and 6 of operand are transfered to bit 7 and 6 of SR (N,V);
the zero-flag is set according to the result of the operand AND
the accumulator (set, if the result is zero, unset otherwise).
This allows a quick check of a few bits at once without affecting
any of the registers, other than the status register (SR).
